ResourceHeader.Description: The Magnetometer Array for Cusp and Cleft Studies (MACCS) program operates magnetometers in the arctic to study the near-Earth space environment and have been providing 0.5 s resolution since 2011.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: The authors thank M. J. Engebretson and the rest of the MACCS team for data. MACCS is operated by Augsburg Univerity and funded by the U.S. National Science Foundation.

PublicationInfo.Authors: Engebretson, Mark J.; Steinmetz, Erik; & Moldwin, Mark

Funding.Agency: NSF Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
Funding.Project: Collaborative Research: Studies of Magnetospheric and Ionospheric Dynamics Using the Magnetometer Array for Cusp and Cleft Studies (MACCS)
